divs: sighting details3\18\2010. facing west, mars on left, pollux in center, and castor on right. how pretty! until castor started drifting away, then made u-turns and little circles, all within a degree of where "castor" is suppose to be. then it returns to its spot. after about a minute, it starts moving around again. different directions, different turns and patterns each time, but always returning to pretend to be a star for 30-60 seconds, then take off again. sometimes slowly and sometimes quickly. with pollux right there, it's movement is quite obvious. i watched it do this for 2 hours that first night. i've been watching it every night since then, about 2 weeks. got the neighbors to see it too. why is no one else noticing this but us? the whole globe can see it with the naked eye! nothing in the news or internet. what's going on? someone just go outside and look at it, and film it. it's there every night and all night.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Everywhere on the globe
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: "Castor" is moving around and has been for weeks.
